lines.text: I am a vampire.
Oh, yeah? Well, abacadabra, I'm an umpire.
[suddenly is wearing umpire clothes]
Hocus-pocus, I'm a bat!
[turns into a bat]
OK. I'm a bat too! Abacadabra!
[turns into a baseball bat]

[putting on glasses]
You wouldn't hit a bat with glasses on, would you?
[Bat hits vampire]
[Count Bloodcount leads Bugs to a bedroom in the castle]
This is your room.
Eh, sure, Doc, but I don't want a room. I just want a telephone.

[putting Bugs to bed]
Rest first; telephone tomorrow. Rest is good for the blood.

[yawns]
Well, I am a little fati-gued.

[seeing a vampire bat that is really a transformed Count Bloodcount]
Golly! What big mosquitoes they do have here.
[He takes a fly swatter]
Hold still, you little devil.
[He swats the bat with the swatter]
There!

[seeing a sign reading "Pittsburghe, Transylvania"]
These Pennsylvania hardwoods ain't too soft.
[Bugs arrives at the door of the castle of Count Bloodcount and rings the doorbell. The Count answers the door]
Sorry to disturb you, sir. I know it's late, but I seem to be off me course.
No, no, it's never too late. Come in.
[the Count opens the door and lets Bugs in]
Yeah, well, you see, I just want to call me travel agency. They've routed me off me route.
[Bugs again sees Count Bloodcount as a bat, but thinks it's a different bat]
Another one? They oughta screen this place.
[He takes a sprayer and sprays the bat with it]
Abraca-pocus.
[Count Bloodcount becomes a bat's head on a vampire's body]
Hmm, uh... hocus-cadabra.
[the Count turns into his head with bat wings]
Newport News!
[the Count turns into Witch Hazel]
Wow, I can do better than that. Walla Walla, Washington!
[the Count as Witch Hazel turns into a male two-headed vulture]
